question: What is Beverly Johnson known for?

content.source_1: of two children to Gloria Johnson, a surgical technician, Johnson was raised in a middle-class family in Buffalo, New York. During her youth, Johnson was a champion swimmer and aspired to be a lawyer. Johnson attended Bennett High School, graduating in 1969. After high school, Johnson went on to study criminal justice at Northeastern University. While in college, Johnson tried modeling while on summer break in 1971. She quickly landed an assignment with "Glamour" and began working steadily. She went on to appear on more than 500 magazine covers, including the August 1974 issue of "Vogue", becoming the magazine's first
content.source_2: Beverly Johnson (climber) Beverly Johnson (22 April 1947 â€“ 3 April 1994) was a pioneering rock climber and adventurer. Johnson was born in Annapolis, Maryland and as the daughter of a Navy Officer travelled significantly in her early years. They settled in Arlington, Virginia and she attended Yorktown, Virginia High School, graduating in 1965, later attending Kent State University where she trekked with the mountaineering club and the University of Southern California. After graduating from college her first job was making parkas in Sun Valley, Idaho later doing cross country ski instructing. Later she moved to Yosemite working on firefighting
content.source_3: for District 3. Beverly Johnson (politician) Beverly Johnson is an American attorney and politician, former mayor of Alameda, California. She was first elected to Alameda City Council in 1998. In 2002, she ran for mayor and was elected. She was elected again as mayor in 2006. Her term ended in December 2010. Johnson is a family law attorney practicing under the name "Johnson Family Law" in Alameda. Johnson's 2002 re-election was tainted by newspaper articles suggesting possible election law chicanery on the part of actors close to Don Perata.
